headline.main: In Pursuit of Cohen, One Dead End

docs.abstract: The government's strategy of relying on lower-level employees to investigate Steven A. Cohen is not without its challenges. | Jack Ma, the founder of Alibaba, is giving up his C.E.O. title but staying on as executive chairman. | Shares of Dell rose on Monday after a report that the company was in talks over a potential buyout. | Thomas Weisel, a legendary banker behind Yahoo's public offering, has been thrust in the spotlight for backing Lance Armstrong.
